intro: Clidemia garcia-barrigae, commonly known as the misty mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and often have a glossy appearance. Clidemia garcia-barrigae thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in forest understories.
